refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: These macros and variables let you check the version of &gdk-pixbuf; you're linking against.

refsect2.title: gdk_pixbuf_version
refsect2.para: Contains the full version of the &gdk-pixbuf; library as a string. This is the version currently in use by a running program.

refsect2.title: gdk_pixbuf_major_version
refsect2.para: The major version number of the &gdk-pixbuf; library. (e.g. in &gdk-pixbuf; version 1.2.5 this is 1.)

This variable is in the library, so represents the &gdk-pixbuf; library you have linked against. Contrast with the GDK_PIXBUF_MAJOR macro, which represents the major version of the &gdk-pixbuf; headers you have included.

refsect2.title: gdk_pixbuf_minor_version
refsect2.para: The minor version number of the &gdk-pixbuf; library. (e.g. in &gdk-pixbuf; version 1.2.5 this is 2.)

This variable is in the library, so represents the &gdk-pixbuf; library you have linked against. Contrast with the GDK_PIXBUF_MINOR macro, which represents the minor version of the &gdk-pixbuf; headers you have included.

refsect2.title: gdk_pixbuf_micro_version
refsect2.para: The micro version number of the &gdk-pixbuf; library. (e.g. in &gdk-pixbuf; version 1.2.5 this is 5.)

This variable is in the library, so represents the &gdk-pixbuf; library you have linked against. Contrast with the GDK_PIXBUF_MICRO macro, which represents the micro version of the &gdk-pixbuf; headers you have included.

refsect2.title: GDK_PIXBUF_VERSION
refsect2.para: Contains the full version of the &gdk-pixbuf; header as a string. This is the version being compiled against; contrast with gdk_pixbuf_version.

refsect2.title: GDK_PIXBUF_MAJOR
refsect2.para: Major version of &gdk-pixbuf; library, that is the first "0" in "0.8.0" for example.

refsect2.title: GDK_PIXBUF_MINOR
refsect2.para: Minor version of &gdk-pixbuf; library, that is the "8" in "0.8.0" for example.

refsect2.title: GDK_PIXBUF_MICRO
refsect2.para: Micro version of &gdk-pixbuf; library, that is the last "0" in "0.8.0" for example.
